heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 04 September 2025 and continued for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is not an active heatwave.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.5°C) and outside temperature (down 5.2°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 12851 lux), pressure (down 12 mbar), and cloud levels (up 424 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 11052 lux) and cloud levels (up 1107 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 423.7m lower than yesterday, 67.1m lower than the past week, 1106.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 767m to 3570m and averaged 1428.8m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and some sunny spells will occur. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.
